title: Pumpkin spice season 2019: Get a pumpkin fix at Starbucks, Krispy Kreme, Dunkin' and more
text:
CLOSE For 16 years, Starbucks' Pumpkin Spice Latte has reigned supreme, but this season there's a new coffee drink spicing things up. USA TODAY

Pumpkin spice fans, here's another reason to get pumped up.

Starbucks has added a second pumpkin drink – the Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew – in addition to the Pumpkin Spice Latte or PSL for short, which returned Aug. 27.

This is Starbucks’ first new pumpkin coffee drink since it launched the PSL – the drink that experts say started the pumpkin craze – in 2003. The drink is made with Starbucks Cold Brew, vanilla, and is finished with a pumpkin cream cold foam and a pumpkin spice topping.

“With customer excitement for PSL sweeping the nation each fall, we wanted to create a new beverage that combines two of our customers’ favorite things, pumpkin spices and cold brew,” said Matthew Thornton, of Starbucks beverage research and development team, in a statement to USA TODAY.

Spooky special items: Starbucks, Burger King, Krispy Kreme and Dunkin' scaring up Halloween-themed items

Toys R Us comeback: New Toys R Us Adventure interactive play lands open and stores coming soon

According to Starbucks, the PSL is its top-selling seasonal beverage of all time with more than 424 million sold in the U.S. since its release 16 years ago. The PSL is available hot, iced or as a Frappuccino-blended beverage.

As part of the fall menu, Starbucks also brought back the Salted Caramel Mocha, pumpkin cream cheese muffin and pumpkin scone.

Apester, a digital storytelling content platform, said 62.5% of consumers surveyed said they thought Starbucks is releasing its pumpkin drink too early this year. Last year, pumpkin returned to Starbucks on Aug. 28, a day dubbed Pumpkinox.

The pumpkin pandemonium started Aug. 21 at Dunkin' locations nationwide when its new fall lineup with new and returning items arrived. The return was six days earlier than in 2018.

CLOSE It may still be summer, but the taste of fall is already in the air in and in stores. Wochit

Now available

The following items are available for a limited time and while supplies last at participating locations.

7-Eleven: Pumpkin spice hot coffee and pumpkin spice latte are available for a limited time. For a limited time with the convenience store's 7Rewards program, get any size cup for $1.

Au Bon Pain: Get a pumpkin scone or croissant as part of a seasonal menu.

Bruegger’s Bagels: Pumpkin bagels, pumpkin cream cheese and pumpkin spice coffee are available for a limited time.

Bruster's Ice Cream: Through Nov. 28, Bruster's has a number of pumpkin-flavored ice cream including pumpkin cheesecake, pumpkin pie ripple, pumpkin pecan and more.

Cracker Barrel: The Pumpkin Pie Latte is available nationwide.

Culver's: The chain has pumpkin items including the Salted Caramel Pumpkin Concrete Mixer and Pumpkin Spice Shake.

Cumberland Farms: The convenience store chain has had a variety of fall-inspired coffee flavors and treats since early September, including a pumpkin spice cappuccino and a pumpkin spiced flavor pump. New and remodeled stores will also have a pumpkin-filled pretzel.

Do you have a favorite pumpkin recipe? Try these delicious pumpkin recipes from our website: https://t.co/c6F3aqmvC4#NationalPumpkinDaypic.twitter.com/x67tYDrnzt — Nutrition Gov (@Nutrition_gov) October 24, 2019

Dairy Queen: The seasonal Pumpkin Pie Blizzard is back for a limited time.

Denny’s: Pumpkin pancakes are back for a limited time.

Dunkin’: Dunkin’s Pumpkin Flavored Coffee, pumpkin doughnut, muffins and Munchkins donut holes are back along with the new Cinnamon Sugar Pumpkin Signature Latte. Pumpkin flavor swirl can be added to hot, iced coffee, Cold Brew, espresso drinks, frozen coffee and frozen chocolate.

Einstein Bros. Bagels: The chain's pumpkin bagel and shmear launched nationwide Aug. 29 for a limited time.

Elevation Burger: The Pumpkin Pie Milkshake is available through Dec. 31.

Fatburger: Get the Pumpkin Spice Shake for a limited time.

First Watch: Pumpkin pancakes, part of the “Harvest the Season” menu, are available through Nov. 3.

Krispy Kreme: The chain's Classic Pumpkin Spice Cake Doughnut and Pumpkin Spice Latte are available through Thanksgiving.

Mimi’s Bistro & Bakery: Mimi’s brought back its Pumpkin Spice Muffin and Pumpkin Spice Latte Aug. 28.

It’s fall y’all! No better way to celebrate than with the Pumpkin Coffee High Protein. No syrups. All delicious. pic.twitter.com/7ucNaZSR8C — Smoothie King (@SmoothieKing) September 14, 2019

Noodles & Company: A new limited-time menu item, the Pumpkin Spice Crispy will be available through Nov. 26 or while supplies last.

Olive Garden: The Chocolate Chunkin' Pumpkin Cheesecake is available for a limited time.

Peet’s Coffee: The seasonal lineup featuring a Pumpkin Latte and Pumpkin Chai Latte is available Sept. 4 through Nov. 5.

Pilot Flying J: Available while supplies last, participating Pilot and Flying J Travel Centers will have a new pumpkin drink, the Pumpkin Maple Cappuccino.

PJ’s Coffee: Pumpkin items including Pumpkin Praline Velvet Ice, Pumpkin Latte and Pumpkin Swirl Bread are available through Oct. 31.

Popeyes Louisiana Kitchen: For a limited time, get the Pumpkin Cream Cheese Pie for a suggested price of $1.19.

QuickChek: Pumpkin offerings include hot and iced pumpkin spice coffee, caramel pumpkin cappuccino, pumpkin spice tea, frozen pumpkin latte, pumpkin bisque, pumpkin cheesecake muffins and pumpkin mini loaves.

Scooter's Coffee: For a limited time, get the Pumpkin Caramelicious or Pumpkin Spice Latte, which are available hot, iced or as a blender. There's also a Pumpkin Pie Shake smoothie.

Shoney's: Get Pumpkin Pie Milkshakes, Pumpkin Pancakes and Spiced Pumpkin Infused Coffee for a limited time along with pumpkin pie during the chain's annual Pumpkin Fest.

Smoothie King: For a limited time, there are various pumpkin smoothies including the Pumpkin Coffee High Protein, Pumpkin D-Lite smoothie and Pumpkin Vegan smoothie. You can also choose to add organic pumpkin to a smoothie for 99 cents. Only on Oct. 26, get buy-one-get-one free pumpkin smoothies with the Healthy Rewards app.

Starbucks: The fall menu returned Aug. 27.

Steak ’n Shake: The Pumpkin Spice Milkshake is back for a limited time.

Taco John's: Pumpkin churros are available for a limited time.

TCBY: Pumpkin Pie soft serve frozen yogurt is available starting Sept. 1 for a limited time.

The Coffee Bean & Tea Leaf: A limited-edition fall menu arrived Aug. 28 with the Pumpkin Latte and Pumpkin Chocolate Muffin.

Tim Hortons: The seasonal lineup includes the Pumpkin Spice Iced Capp, Pumpkin Spice Iced Latte, Pumpkin Spice Latte, Pumpkin Spice Timbit, Pumpkin Spice Donut and Pumpkin Spice Muffin.

TooJay's Deli: For a limited time, get Pumpkin Spice Cake and Pumpkin Cheesecake.

Tropical Smoothie Cafe: The Pumpkin Pie Smoothie is part of a limited-time fall menu.

Wawa: Pumpkin spice specialty beverages, coffee and cappuccino returned Aug. 26.

Wienerschnitzel: The Pumpkin Spice lineup includes an Oreo Cookie Pumpkin Spice Shake, a Pumpkin Spice Dipped Cone and a traditional Pumpkin Spice Shake.

Coming soon

Grimaldi’s Pizzeria: On Nov. 1, Grimaldi’s Pumpkin Spice Cheesecake returns and will be available for the month of November.

At the store

Here are some of the products that are either carving out a spot on store shelves or will soon be added. Selection varies and quantities of these seasonal items are limited. More products are expected to come out before Halloween and additional items will be available at online specialty stores. Popular stores for shopping for pumpkin spice foods include Aldi, Trader Joe's, Fresh Market, Whole Foods Market and Sprouts Farmers Market.

Beverages: Multiple brands of pumpkin spice coffee, creamer, teas and cocoa. Creamer options include: Laird Superfood’s Pumpkin Spice Creamer, International Delight Pumpkin Pie Spice Flavored Creamer, Silk Pumpkin Spice Almond Creamer, Coffee mate Pumpkin Spice and natural bliss Pumpkin Spice. Super Coffee has a new Maple Pumpkin bottled coffee, which is keto friendly and has zero grams of sugar, 80 calories, MCT oil and 10 grams of protein. The brand also is launching a Super Espresso and Super Creamer in this line.

Pastries: Grocery stores often have fresh-baked cookies and popular packaged varieties include Milano Pumpkin Spice cookies, Kodiak Cakes’ Pumpkin Dark Chocolate Muffin Unleashed and Base Culture’s Nutty Pumpkin Bread. Thomas’ Pumpkin Spice English Muffins and bagels are expected to arrive in stores Sept. 10 and Sugar Bowl Bakery’s new Pumpkin Madeleines and Pumpkin Fritters will start rolling out stores in September. Pillsbury Grands! Pumpkin Spice Sweet Rolls and other Pillsbury pumpkin products are rolling out to stores now.

Protein bars and powder: Pumpkin has also made its way into some protein drinks and bars. Options that will be available in stores and online include Lenny & Larry’s Pumpkin Spice Complete Cookie, Quest Pumpkin Pie protein bars and ONE Pumpkin Pie bars. BSN SYNTHA-6 Pumpkin Pie protein powder is available at GNC, Vitamin Shoppe and Amazon.

Yogurt: Chobani Greek Yogurt Pumpkin & Spice, Chobani Flip Autumn Harvest Crisp and Dannon Light & Fit Pumpkin Pie, noosa yoghurt in pumpkin and Nounós Pumpkin Spice.

Ice cream: Halo Top’s Pumpkin Pie is returning for the third year and this year there also will be a non-dairy and vegan version. My/Mo Mochi Ice Cream is launching two new fall-themed limited-time flavors including Pumpkin Spice. Bubbies has Pumpkin Mochi at Whole Foods and other grocers, and Enlightened Ice Cream's seasonal Pumpkin Spice Latte returns Sept. 9. Not an ice cream, but Daiya has a plant-based Pumpkin Spice Cheezecake, available in the freezer section.

Miscellaneous: Pumpkin pasta sauce, salsa and pumpkin-flavored Spam. Native Pumpkin Spice Latte deodorant goes on sale online starting Sept. 9.

Snacks: Nature’s Bakery Pumpkin Spice Fig Bars will be available in Target and Whole Foods nationwide around mid-September. Bobo’s Pumpkin Spice Oat Bar will be available online and Kind has Caramel Almond Pumpkin Spice bars. SMASHMALLOW pumpkin pie marshmallows are available at Target.

Who has the best chicken sandwich?: Popeyes, Chick-fil-A and Wendy's are clucking on social media

New food brand: Target launches its largest brand, Good & Gather, with more than 2,000 items

CLOSE Along with the arrival of fall, we should brace for all things pumpkin spice. But one product may have taken the "fall favorite" flavor a bit too far. Buzz60

Follow USA TODAY reporter Kelly Tyko on Twitter: @KellyTyko

Read or Share this story: https://www.usatoday.com/story/money/food/2019/08/20/pumpkin-spice-season-2019-when-starbucks-psl-returns/2036618001/
description: Starbucks' Pumpkin Spice Latte and new Pumpkin Cream Cold Brew have arrived. Dunkin', Dairy Queen, 7-Eleven, Krispy Kreme also have the fall flavor.
